A3740DA913974C8CB68BA5B75EEEA512.description: Participate in drama as members of an artistic community

7DC5001736B6457091D51D3D4469D446.description: Culture was revealed through dramatic performances during the Middle Ages.

8B06907138F74D98BE6762D175D1E134.description: Drama and storytelling in Alberta can reflect the culture of those who came before us and those who live here now.

A821B08EB1594077BB9DEB7A931579A8.description: The culture of an artistic community is about shared ways of being together and reaching common goals.

B343F17697744D64958CB9DB1EEE04A4.description: When communities unite through the arts, culture can be learned.

D1713D72F1CC4A72B2617C91470F031F.description: Rumi (1207-273) was an important Muslim poet who influenced many cultures and whose poetry is still recited today

60FEC10D26D941B2B17913367008A61F.description: Theatrical performances in medieval Islamic cultures included poetry recitations and storytelling that occurred outside.

CA1488B834A94427A2CEAC0F396F6852.description: Performances in medieval Europe included various kinds of drama, such as stories based on the Bible interludes, which are short comical plays farces based on unlikely situations

1D9CF3BFCF6C42638399C623CC727ECC.description: Some performances in medieval Europe happened inside churches, while others were held outside, in towns and villages, for everyone to see

52D208A22E2C4D53A97A64EF57D59240.description: Drama in the Middle Ages used various dramatic forms, including mime acrobatics juggling singing (minstrels) storytelling shadow puppetry narrative drama

916C0A4256AC4FC5A6EA1C9A537338D8.description: Performers may have been part of a membership called a guild and travelled and performed throughout various communities

423A3BEC27B645AEAEBEA7F2D454074D.description: Performers throughout the Middle Ages often used their art to transfer and preserve their skills and traditions

26E94F34FD9F4140998F1B853AEDE36B.description: Cowboy poetry is a form of performance that grew out of the culture of cowboys telling stories

9A57E2F010E74DD594AFA0ECFD41EE0B.description: Communities in Alberta may share their cultural traditions through a variety of formal or informal dramatic practices, such as readings, recitations, and storytelling.

77C34A1CE4BD42C2A85255EA6AB53D1A.description: First Nations, MÃ©tis, and Inuit knowledge shared through storytelling can share teachings and histories communicate values and beliefs show gratitude and reverence demonstrate reciprocity reflect spirituality contribute to healing guide and direct choices and actions

9AF0CD6CA693462AA80232318D4A5E4D.description: The culture of an artistic community can support the caring and respectful inclusion of all participants

9356D332207140D49D5687629E7B4AD9.description: Culture can be enhanced when members of a drama community participate, communicate, engage, and share responsibilities.

1B112D39605247FC84DFF832460E9F9A.description: Students relate how culture is reflected in drama and storytelling across time and place

AB4ED6AA125F45E39D64AFF5242178C6.description: Appreciation: Recognizing beauty, goodness, and truth in drama can be developed by understanding the complexity and richness of great dramatic works, the artists who create and perform them, and the historical and cultural contexts from which they originate.

1867037226EE400DAFC9C42FA65E2E3B.description: Respond to verbal cues given by a director when rehearsing a narrative.

74A01A1750F14D98A2C886B397340299.description: A narrative in drama can be illustrated as a partial or whole representation.

39CC5F0A174D4C85A99BFB0C2F99B38E.description: Working with an ensemble can develop skills that can be transferred to other areas of learning.

FCB33E63FE05413D95EF92C9E6B2B8E5.description: Creative processes, including rehearsal, can help a performer refine expression of a narrative in drama

F56CC6BA55B643E99CD508564B5A50BB.description: A director can shape a narrative by giving verbal cues that guide the performer or ensemble

E4B5FBEEFE3A4856BBA6F9C7CB68DA16.description: Vocal production and body movement may need to be adjusted when performing for an audience.

90674D875DEB4A0CB077D91A31B5F3F6.description: Dramatic forms, including readers' theatre and choral speech, are prepared scripts that can be used to tell a narrative.

5DA6DC9BDB0049DC8C2C31F58224DC63.description: Blocking can help clarify positioning and movement of actors when performing a narrative.

48520D8339834E9B8D225B999E36441F.description: A narrative can be communicated non-verbally through the use of movements, as seen in mime or tableau

66A36A3F52854E8EAB611DE0646A0710.description: Vocal expression can change the meaning of words expressed in a narrative.

F342533A21BD43D996993C0C2DB978EB.description: A performer can make experimental or informed artistic choices to shape a narrative, including the choice of costumes props sets lights voice movement

273C17BC6C9945A4A2D1CC8EFBA5E7DF.description: Status communicates the relationships between two characters.

537F6A0FB8244C8F9C991BCD06A3CBB6.description: Communication of a narrative can feature a character's intention, status, or feelings through role play.

3A6B6E6CF53A467D9CE2897CE48AA6BB.description: Empathy can influence how a narrative is communicated

38618F9F98F34D0F9C149C904C3D38A6.description: Points of view or perspectives can reflect feelings, experiences, and culture.

E1C47E294566494F9D9C2309C0ADF379.description: Inspiration for a narrative may come from stories documentaries different forms of media conversations imagination people or characters

BBC42DAC79BF43DBBEFC19E30A03E088.description: Dramatic forms can give structure to a narrative

33657EC8C251476F81C5EAD1224DCDEC.description: A narrative in drama can be structured in a variety of ways, including a theme a vignette - a short episode a scene an act an entire play

3519AACAD3F94B318C231488292A216D.description: A narrative in drama may or may not represent a sequence of events in the order in which they happened

32C554EACF6E432AA8056C47E3F6C524.description: Students employ narrative as a structure for organizing, creating, and presenting dramatizations.

174D2F2B75DA449F96191DE3655EC176.description: Creating and Presenting: Ideas can be represented dramatically through artworks that draw upon foundational knowledge

3AEAAE0D601647C5A426B59B53002D49.description: Participate in warm-up activities that prepare the body and voice for expression

53A737F026FE4D66BFAAF28DE8B1DF4A.description: Discuss how empathy and perspectives can guide character development.

25ADE01CC4084BCDACD7D350B7009659.description: The voice is dependent on the body.

77F0EA7CDB2742C789BD39AAE19FE9E5.description: The voice can communicate intent in the way that it is used on its own or when paired with body movements.

9115E5F0FE174A968BDE2D873BA3377B.description: Expression can be enhanced when the body and voice are combined

20167C5E7A704B95913B9DC03605285D.description: The body can be analyzed through movement, space, and relationships.

300488F010ED4D728C01A0EA6735B1FD.description: What a person is thinking and how they are feeling can influence how they portray a character.

75D9997E3AE7418B8435832BB0D706DC.description: The body and mind connect thinking and feeling to make meaning

E31257F4EF774137984C096FD70248AF.description: Voice can be communicated through sign language and gesture

65EAC62AB3C04D928CBE5D4D8C894C9D.description: The voice is the combination of breath and the vibration of vocal cords

1B77B4C0AD634F5FB140D3176736249F.description: Safe projection of the voice includes appropriate breath support, volume, and control

E8D23682D5F6438C9094ADBB8E463CCE.description: The body and the voice function optimally when warmed up and exercised

BA01CA1FD5494780ADED4A9C49E4C313.description: Voice production relies on body positioning.

9AED798550404129965E2BEF78F49B12.description: The diaphragm is a muscle that supports vocal health and production and projection of the voice

B8D57B2505484DB388E2F7E6E01CF100.description: The voice has many qualities that make it identifiable (timbre) and can include shouting, whispering, singing, and speaking

B11137F5BD6C47CD963DE3E7B7A8B24F.description: Soundscapes express environments, moods, and scenarios through the use of tone, breath, volume, and vocal sound effects

D6750848E0A04A2FA1C4583002AC8709.description: Words and meaning can change based on tone volume timing pace rhythm

B5B8805714DC4CD7A02F03C6DE3F63B8.description: Readers' theatre skills help develop the ability to communicate from a prepared script

7AF392A40CD6489A88660B8C0341EC2C.description: Radio play is an auditory dramatic form that features music, dialogue, and sound effects to highlight characters and story

E8E0C4EF46C74235AF1C025CF71BF413.description: Speaking skills can help develop vocal expression through exploration of tone, volume, and timing

5CB5A631B1CE46C8A86A2C8C3BC6C131.description: Body expression has a relationship to other characters space situations props voice

814818C66BB44CE09420DA41F8AE1734.description: Blocking involves body movement and positioning that contributes to the staging of presentations in drama.

263786939BD3440AB887294C4B29A146.description: A situation in drama has structure that includes time and place.

6642D72C23D64E65A12D8FCE2460798A.description: A character is developed through the body and in relation to the dramatic role and situation

F8131F41414D4846BB2F4850C38BC574.description: Group drama is a dramatic form used to collaboratively build a dramatization through the acceptance of ideas

4A01C5101D8E4A09B957E2475A3A6E3D.description: Imagination and prior knowledge can guide role play

DA4634B860B646938B92A5F63572B83A.description: Role-playing skills support the ability to use the body to take on the attitude of another individual assume the physical attributes of another individual empathize the situation of another individual

CB4A8748B46C4418B0C57D7ED71931B9.description: Students relate the voice and the body as a means to portray roles, characters, and situations.

7FCA6C81139F417AB21964DE2AECA266.description: Foundational Elements: Drama literacy is developed through knowledge and application of dramatic processes.
